newsitem.title: USA: Washington state says Dec unemployment inched up.
newsitem.headline: Washington state says Dec unemployment inched up.

text.p: Severe winter storms and normal seasonal slowdowns in the economy pushed Washington's unemployment rate up three-tenths of a percentage point to 6.1 percent in December, the state said on Tuesday.

"Pullbacks in construction, agriculture, food processing, and tourism, in particular, set the tone as winter weather hit the state hard," state Employment Security Department Acting Commissioner Wendy Holden said in a statement.
While the uptick in the jobless count was larger than usual for the month, the rate remained below the 6.4 percent level of a year ago, the state said.
